titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-05-24T14:22-0400

did.unittitle: New York Hard Hat News Records
did.physloc: This collection is stored offsite and advance notice is required for access.
did.abstract: The New York Hard Hat News is a quarterly newspaper for construction workers in the New York metropolitan area that covers topics of concern to workers in the building trades, with a strong emphasis on efforts to both increase union democracy as well as combat corruption. The collection contains materials collected in order to prepare and print the paper, including clippings, subject files and administrative files.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Jane LaTour and Guy Robinson, August 2002

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged in two series: Managing Editor's Files and Editor's Files.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2630
Fax: (212) 995-4225
E-mail: tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The New York Hard Hat News is a quarterly newspaper for construction workers in the New York metropolitan area. Also known as Hard Hat News, it covers topics of concern to workers in the building trades, with a strong emphasis on efforts to both increase union democracy as well as combat corruption.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Contains materials collected in order to prepare and print New York Hard Hat News, including clippings, subject files and administrative files.
